intro: Jacquemontia sandwicensis f. hosakae, commonly known as the Haleakala Jacquemontia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to the volcanic soils and dry conditions of the Haleakala National Park. It is a federally listed endangered species, highlighting its ecological significance and conservation status. Its limited distribution and unique morphology make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
